text: Barbican Press is an independent publishing house launched in 2013 by Martin J. Goodman for "innovative novels that are just too edgy for the mainstream but allow people to break all bounds and find a unique voice."Ann Morgan, "Find Yourself on a Creative Writing Course", The Guardian, 10 November 2014. Accessed 25 May 2015. Its titles include Kate Horsley's The Monster's Wife, shortlisted for Scottish First Book of the Year 2014.,Alistair Munro, "Kate Horsley 'found Frankenstein's bride in Orkney'", The Scotsman, 19 October 2014. Accessed 25 May 2015. Brian W. Lavery's The Headscarf Revolutionaries, and DD Johnston's The Secret Baby Room. ==References== Category:Publishing companies of England Category:Publishing companies established in 2013
